description: Creation of self-contained flat including rear roof extension with dormer windows with external rear stairs with increase in existing roof height, reduction in existing ground floor ceiling heights (part-retrospective).
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
The external finishing materials shall match those used in the construction of the existing building and/or areas of hard surfacing. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Pre Ground Floor Plan- Plan no. 12. 1276/006 CPre Existing East Elevation- Plan no. 12 1276/007 BPre Existing North Elevation- Plan no. 12. 1276/008  Pre-Existing Section AA -Plan no. 12. 1276/009 A Pre Existing South Elevation- Plan no. 12 1276/10 A Pre Existing Roof Plan- Plan no 12. 1276/012 AExisting GF Plan As Built- Plan no. 12. 1276/302 AExisting East Elevation as Built- Plan no. 12. 1276/303 BExisting South Elevation as Built- Plan no. 12. 1276/304Existing North Elevation as Built- Plan no. 12. 1276/305Existing Section A-A- Plan no. 12. 1276/306Existing Section B-B- Plan no. 12. 1276/306Existing 1F Plan as Built- Plan no. 12. 1276/308Existing Roof Plan as Built- Plan no 12. 1276/309 BProposed 1F Plan- Plan no. 12. 1276/202Proposed East Elevation- Plan no. 12. 1276/203 BProposed South Elevation- Plan no. 12. 1276/204Proposed North Elevation- Plan no. 12. 1276/205Proposed Section A-A- Plan no. 12 1276/206Proposed Section B-B- Plan no. 12 1276/207Proposed Roof Plan- Plan no. 12. 1276/208 BReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.Energy Statement- dated October 2024

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of the 4 long-stay cycle parking spaces have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details shall include:Location: Near entrances or main access Design: Sheffield stands or wall bars Security: Secure, overlooked, well-lit Coverage: Covered where possible Accessibility: Step-free, no obstructions The cycle parking spaces shall be fully constructed in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation and shall thereafter be retained for the lifetime of the development. REASON: The Council's Climate Action and Transport Policies seek to increase the use of active and sustainable transport modes. This means that access to bicycle parking should be easy and secure to remove potential barriers to cycling.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until waste storage and recycling facilities to satisfy the future number of occupiers on site have been provided within the development, in accordance with the Enfield's Household Recycling and Waste Planning Guidance for New Developments (February 2024). Such facilities to be retained  for the lifetime of the development.REASON: In order to facilitate efficient, safe and clean removal of household refuse, the location and accessibility of refuse storage plus to maintain safety on the Highway.

The residential unit(s) hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the Building Regulations Optional requirement G2 for water consumption of no more than 105 litres or less per head per day (excluding allowance of up to five litres for external water consumption) has been complied with. The measures shall thereafter be permanently retained.
